Group.title: Generic required services
Group.description: Some services need to be deployed in order to ensure basic verifications and reporting on GNU/Linux operating systems. Each of these service take part in the administrability of the system.

Rule.title: install the auditd service
Rule.description: The auditd service should be installed.
Rule.rationale: The auditd service is an access monitoring and accounting daemon, watching system calls to audit any access, in comparision with potential local access control policy such as SELinux policy.

Rule.title: Enable the auditd service
Rule.description: The auditd service should be enabled.
Rule.rationale: The auditd service is an access monitoring and accounting daemon, watching system calls to audit any access, in comparision with potential local access control policy such as SELinux policy.

Rule.title: Install the cron service
Rule.description: The Cron service should be installed.
Rule.rationale: The cron service allow periodic job execution, needed for almost all administrative tasks and services (software update, log rotating, etc.). Access to cron service should be restricted to administrative accounts only.

Rule.title: Enable the cron service
Rule.description: The Cron service should be enabled.
Rule.rationale: The cron service allow periodic job execution, needed for almost all administrative tasks and services (software update, log rotating, etc.). Access to cron service should be restricted to administrative accounts only.

Rule.title: Install the ntp service
Rule.description: The ntpd service should be installed.
Rule.rationale: Time synchronization (using NTP) is required by almost all network and administrative tasks (syslog, cryptographic based services (authentication, etc.), etc.). Ntpd is regulary maintained and updated, supporting security features such as RFC 5906.

Rule.title: Enable the ntpd service
Rule.description: The ntpd service should be enabled.
Rule.rationale: Time synchronization (using NTP) is required by almost all network and administrative tasks (syslog, cryptographic based services (authentication, etc.), etc.). Ntpd is regulary maintained and updated, supporting security features such as RFC 5906.
